
These sequences are of the form

a(n) = unique number having n digits A or B which is divisible by 2^n

where 0 < A < B < 10 are two nonzero digits with opposite parity.

It is somewhat remarkable that this definition defines a(n) uniquely.

Also note that they are not "all the same" up to substitution of the digits
Table of the digits:

* 1,2 : A053312 = 2, 12, 112, 2112, 22112, 122112, 2122112, 12122112, 212122112, 1212122112
* 1,4 : A053314 = 4, 44, 144, 4144, 14144, 414144, 1414144, 41414144, 441414144, 1441414144
* 1,6 : Axxx = 6, 16, 616, 1616, 11616, 111616, 6111616, 16111616, 616111616, 1616111616
* 1,8 : Axxx = 8, 88, 888, 1888, 81888, 181888, 8181888, 18181888, 118181888, 8118181888
* 2,3 : A053316 = 2, 32, 232, 3232, 23232, 223232, 2223232, 32223232, 232223232, 3232223232
* 2,5 : Axxx = 2, 52, 552, 5552, 55552, 255552, 5255552, 55255552, 255255552, 2255255552
* 2,7 : Axxx = 2, 72, 272, 2272, 22272, 222272, 7222272, 27222272, 727222272, 2727222272
* 2,9 : Axxx = 2, 92, 992, 2992, 92992, 292992, 2292992, 22292992, 222292992, 2222292992
* 3,4 : A035014 = 4, 44, 344, 3344, 33344, 433344, 3433344, 33433344, 333433344, 3333433344
* 3,6 : Axxx = 6, 36, 336, 6336, 66336, 366336, 6366336, 36366336, 636366336, 3636366336
* 3,8 : Axxx = 8, 88, 888, 3888, 33888, 333888, 3333888, 83333888, 383333888, 3383333888
* 4,5 : Axxx = 4, 44, 544, 4544, 44544, 444544, 4444544, 54444544, 454444544, 5454444544
* 4,7 : Axxx = 4, 44, 744, 7744, 47744, 447744, 4447744, 44447744, 444447744, 4444447744
* 4,9 : Axxx = 4, 44, 944, 4944, 94944, 994944, 4994944, 94994944, 494994944, 9494994944
* 5,6 : Axxx = 6, 56, 656, 6656, 66656, 566656, 6566656, 66566656, 666566656, 6666566656
* 5,8 : Axxx = 8, 88, 888, 5888, 85888, 885888, 8885888, 58885888, 558885888, 8558885888
* 6,7 : Axxx = 6, 76, 776, 7776, 67776, 667776, 6667776, 66667776, 766667776, 6766667776
* 6,9 : Axxx = 6, 96, 696, 9696, 69696, 669696, 6669696, 96669696, 696669696, 9696669696
* 7,8 : Axxx = 8, 88, 888, 7888, 77888, 877888, 7877888, 87877888, 787877888, 8787877888
* 8,9 : Axxx = 8, 88, 888, 9888, 89888, 989888, 9989888, 89989888, 989989888, 8989989888

```
(PARI)
/* Shortest is d[!(t%2^k)+1] = d[2] if !t%2^k <=> t%2^k == 0 <=> need even digit, = d[1] else..
 * So the odd digit must come first.
 */
first(n, d=[1,2], t=0)= d[2]%2 && d=Vecrev(d); vector(n, k, t += d[!(t%2^k)+1]*10^(k-1))

/* explicit exhaustive search (this works only for digits [d,d+1] */
find(n,D=[7,8])=forvec(d=vector(n,i,D),fromdigits(d)%2^n||print(d)) \\ not return() to see all solutions
```
